themes.scientific_basis: Based on optimal arousal theory and research on shared novel experiences in relationship satisfaction
themes.description: Evaluates how couples navigate the balance between comfort and challenge in trying new experiences, including their mutual support in stepping outside comfort zones

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in self-expansion theory (Aron & Aron) and research on relationship boredom prevention
themes.description: Measures how effectively couples incorporate new experiences into their relationship to maintain excitement and prevent hedonic adaptation

themes.scientific_basis: Based on collaborative learning research and studies on shared exploration in relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples approach learning and discovering new things together, including their ability to support each other's curiosity

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from personal growth research and studies on mutual development in relationships
themes.description: Examines how partners balance individual and shared growth through new experiences while maintaining relationship connection

themes.scientific_basis: Based on autobiographical memory research and studies on shared memory formation in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how couples intentionally create and integrate meaningful shared experiences into their relationship narrative

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in decision-making research and studies on relationship spontaneity versus planning
themes.description: Measures how couples balance spontaneous adventures with planned experiences, including their ability to accommodate different preferences

themes.scientific_basis: Based on cultural psychology research and studies on shared cultural experiences in relationships
themes.description: Assesses how couples approach experiencing new cultures, traditions, and perspectives together, enhancing mutual understanding

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from risk assessment psychology and research on couples' approach to uncertainty
themes.description: Examines how partners navigate different comfort levels with risk-taking in new experiences, including decision-making processes

themes.scientific_basis: Based on relationship resilience research and studies on how shared experiences strengthen bonds
themes.description: Measures how effectively couples use new experiences to strengthen their relationship and create lasting positive changes

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in resource management theory and research on couples' decision-making about time and money
themes.description: Evaluates how partners make decisions about investing resources (time, money, energy) in new experiences, including priority alignment
